alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 12:03PM PST until January 30 at 11:17PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Tualatin River at Farmington affecting Washington County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Pudding River at Aurora affecting Clackamas and Marion Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Benton and Polk Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tualatin River at Farmington. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Above 32.0 feet, expect flooding of numerous fields and low-lying farms, along with flooding of a few secondary roads in and around Farmington and Tualatin. Some farmland near the river channel will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM PST Monday the stage was 32.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM PST Monday was 32.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 115 PM PST.
